Reviews.Title: “Not a value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Shani_Halen
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as it was in the Emirates link as we travlled to DUbai in EMirates. We paid about £60 and expected value for it. It was not as per the expectations. We never used the kitchen which was just a small L shaped corner of the same room which was not spacious. There was no bath/and not a proper shower room, just a corner of the toliet was the shower and with curtains and all the water spilled right away outside. But the staff were very friendly. Please do not make the mistake of booking the desert safari from the hotel as its the most horrible experince you can have. There is no group travel for the desert dafari, and this giuy in the 4x4 just gives you a drive and leaves you the tent. He doesnt even stop in the middle of th desert for taking photos. The tent place was really bad, you need to pay for everything and it does not have a proper feel of a desert place. The costumes are horrible, either torn or in a shabby condition. There is no hospitality at all.

Reviews.Title: “Don't rush back”
Reviews.Author: Ali B
Reviews.Content: The apartments are extremely run down and my room did not smell clean. There were broken items and nothing appeared clean. The French windows onto the balcony did not close or lock. The bed was comfortable enough but there was no top sheet. The hot water only lasted for a few minutes despite being switched on overnight and the towels were very worn. There was hardly any kitchen equipment. There was an iron, but nothing as basic as a kettle. The 'high-speed' internet cost 45 AED for 24 hours but I could barely get a single bar of wifi signal. I certainly won't be returning or recommending this place to anyone. Though the price is cheap, I think basic cleanliness and simple comfort isn't too much to expect even in this range.

Reviews.Title: “Mould, dirty, poor service .... health hazard!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lisa T
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 weeks holiday in June/July 2011. Having noticed that people are still complaining about the apartments I feel I owe it to both the hotel and future potential customers to give a review. I arrived at 7 am having travelled overnight I was really tired. The first room I was allocated was a corner room without a fridge and no hob but an extractor fan??? I phoned reception and asked for an apartment as I was at the very least needing a fridge. I was then given a second room which had mould on the ceiling! Yes, I had read a previous review and thought ....some people are fussy. I slept for about 4 hours and it was the smell and congested lungs that woke me. I am a smoker not a health freak by any stretch of imagination. I was then moved to my 3rd and final room. I thought - I guess this is as good as it gets! Popped into the local Spinney Supermarket and armed myself with essential cleaning/scouring products. Scrubbed the shower basin (no bath) and cooking surfaces. Bonus I was travelling alone as there was little in the way of crockery, cutlery. Staff .... pretty disappointing. Asked for a hair dryer from reception first night but waited so long my very long hair had dried when I mentioned to reception on my way out for the night that I hadn't received the hair dryer ??? It is poorly run and wouldn't take a lot to get this place in shape. Probably more staff !!! Location is great if you aren't there for the beach ....plenty shops and night life. I stayed at The Golden Sands Apartments in the street behind on previous trip a month earlier. That was spotless and I never noticed any prostitutes there! If your budget can stretch a little further go for the all round better experience.

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom, poor kitchen equipment but great views from roof top swimming pool”
Reviews.Author: BorntocruiseUK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in January 2012. We were given a room at the back, which turned out to be very busy from the car park. We were woken up on both nights by children in the car park. I think they must have been collected by their parents. Theis was at 1.15am and they were under 10 years old. When we were taken to our room I noticed that there was only one pillow each and only one towel between two of us!! I asked the bell boy if he could get some more but they never materialised. In the kitchen was a washing machine, cooker, microwave. But no pans or any way of heating any thing up. There was two cups, two plates, two spoons and that was it. The cupboards were dirty and in a state of bad repair. There was an iron and ironing board. The bed side lights have round pin plugs but the sockets are the three pin British plugs. Eventually Improvised and plugged in the lights neither of these worked. The bathroom was dirty with a badly stained shower tray. Around the door frame was a build up of fluffy black dust. This was also present on the window frame. The ceiling in the bathroom was mouldy. We didn't try the shower on day one as we didn't get to the room until 11.30pm. In the morning we tried to have a shower. The water would not deviate to the shower attachment. I improvised by sitting in the shower tray as we waited for someone to repair it. Eventually someone did come and say it was broken and then left without resolving the issue. My husband 6'3" had to sit in the shower tray it did makes us giggle. The water went cold so I rang down twice. They were very unhelpful we eventually found out in order to have hot water you have to switch on the heater switch located by the bedroom door. This is fine but only works whilst the key is inserted no good if you have been out all day and need a shower. On our way out I did ask for more towels, for the shower to be mended and also the lights to be fixed. These were addressed. We did have breakfast in the hotel which was fine. The hotel has a roof top swimming pool which is lovey and gives wonderful views of Dubai especially the Burg Khalifa and surrounding area. There is much in the surrounding area and is about 20 min walk to the supermarkets and the Metros. The cabs are so inexpensive that this isn't a problem. Would I stay here again? Maybe yes but I would ask for a room on the front. These have balconies. Yes the rooms were a little poorly equipped but the roof top swimming pool makes up for this.

Reviews.Title: “If your budget is really really and I mean really tight”
Reviews.Author: decosp
Reviews.Content: This hotel should be your last option...after you checked all hotel booking sites and you couldnt find anything cheaper. The good thing is that theres so much to do and see in Dubai that you will spend very little time in this place. Dirty? Yes Needs refurbishment? Yes The famous ripped old carpet in the entrance stairs? Yes still there Wi-Fi? Yes it cost 45 AED for 24 hours but in my room the signal was so bad that I had to stand by the room door to get a signal. Kitchenette? Yes (not sure if is in all rooms) but you just don't dare using any of that Location? In Dubai everything is miles apart so you need a taxi to go anywhere...theres a tube station about 15 mins walking that was handy for the malls. If you still decide to book this place.... well what can I say...good lucky!!!

Reviews.Title: “roll the dice”
Reviews.Author: pel579
Reviews.Content: To start with, why is Dubai full of accommodation where they have both a hotel and appartments, but never together, then the taxi will always take u to the wrong one! Once we arrived.... the carpet on the stairs is disgusting and should have been replaced 10 years ago. the front automatic doors don't work. the guy on reception could not find our booking, because he was looking for the wrong name. they gave us a room and key and when we opened the door to the room, it already had peoples cases in the room. thank god there was no one in the room getting up to mischief! we went back downstairs and asked for another room. we go to the second room and it has single beds when we booked a double, and it stunk of cigarette smoke, yet all rooms are suppose to be non-smoking. back down stairs while they gave us a 3rd room. BINGO, this one worked. it was quite nice, although the shower was sooooo small and no bath. guess in this place you can't get everything. housekeeping was EXTREMELY POOR. the housekeeper was slower than a snail and our room was never serviced before 4pm each of the 6 days we staid there. i caught him sitting watching tv in the room next to ours one day at 5pm and he had not cleaned our room yet. on the second last day he didn't service it because his sheet told him we had moved out. i had to request reception to tell him to clean it and that were still checked in. the only nice part of this hotel was the price and the Philipino reception lady who always had a smile for us.

Reviews.Title: “For survival.”
Reviews.Author: Danny_jp
Reviews.Content: The other reviewers have it pretty much correct. This is a tired old hotel with little or no attention paid to maintenance. I travel A LOT so I'm very flexible. Just need a clean bed and bathroom. Both were clean, but the bathroom has one of those "shower pads" which is only enclosed by the shower curtain. That means the whole floor ends up a wet mess. Won't be coming back. It is, however, a full studio "apartment" so my room had a kitchen with stove, washing machine, toaster, etc. (although couldn't imagine an extended stay here)

Reviews.Title: “The Jormand nightmare hotel”
Reviews.Author: strumfita
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night during our flight overstop! We never saw such a thing, so much dirty, bedbugs, whatever you can imagine, we changed room and it was worse than the first one! I really can´t think of anything positive!!!!!!!!!!!!!!The bathroom, the kitchen, the floor, the bed even the walls and the staff was dirty!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a short stay.”
Reviews.Author: Tajine
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a tourist area where there were several other big hotels although to me the area looked dusty and barren. We arrived early so rooms were not cleaned and ready until later in the day. Normally this wouldn’t be a problem but after a long flight and with the prospects of having to go back out into the heat it wasn’t something I was too happy about. As it happened a room did become available and we did get in early thanks for the really friendly and happy Philippino receptionist. The room was perfectly fine but seemed a bit dark at first because of all the block out curtains to keep the relentless sun. The room wasn’t overly large but there was a kitchenette which was useful for a linger stay. What was odd was the smell, it smelt to me like the air conditioning vents needed to be cleaned and were expelling a really damp dusty odor which seeped into your clothes. There was a swimming pool on the roof which was nice but bizarrely when I went to take a pic the pool attendant freaked out and told me to stop and that it was forbidden to take pictures. Reception area is small with a few seats scattered around but not enough for more than 6 people. Most cabs knew the hotel and I took a cab tour with a driver right outside that was really cheap and actually a lot of fun. I also did the one day jeep safari which is a must. It was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Older, threadbare but safe”
Reviews.Author: Radiant360
Reviews.Content: Got a great deal so we stayed there a week. Not in the center of anything--long way or short cab ride to town. There is a restaurant onsite but I didn't try it. Had to beg for towels but the kitchen is equipped with a plates, cups, silverware and even a cutting board. You get a refrigerator and a microwave but both can't be plugged in at the same time. Stay if you get a deal and don't plan on doing anything but sleeping in your room. Television channel selection is minimal. If you are the tolerant sort, you will be okay here--if not ;pass it by. More of a place for students and the traveler who spends money on other things than rooming.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly, pleasent, convinent, comfortable & safe hotel!”
Reviews.Author: misbav Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd time at Jordmand as the year before I really enjoyed my stay there. Its not only cheap but has all facilites such as gym, pool, sauna, jacuzzy, restaurant ect.. The staff were great really friendly & polite also very helpful. My apartment was an excutive studio, fully equiped kitchen, breakfast bar & balcony. This hotel is great as you can save a lot of money on meals as you have a kitchen and supermarket 2 to 3 minutes walk that sells everything. I recomend this hotel to stay in whether your a couple, family or friends as its peaceful, convienent & safe!

Reviews.Title: “you get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Robandwilson
Reviews.Content: Jormand hotel apartment is budget price hotel apartment. have you heard the quote you get what you pay for, Hotel Jormand had loads of extras, A noise air conditioning unit that was to loud to have on if you wanted to sleep A smell that made you want to open the window in the searing heat A ripped couch so you could see the springs and stains on the walls of the shower overall the highlights were breakfast and leaving we talked to the staff and nothing was done, glad it was only for 2 nights

Reviews.Title: “Good budget price hotel apartment”
Reviews.Author: NJGandhi
Reviews.Content: Jorman hotel apartment is good budget price hotel apartment. With the price you get the hotel apartment with budget price they provide good services and amneities. Located in good area. However service is not so good. Also internet is not good which is main drawback for business travellers

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money; but friendly and courteous reception could go a long way”
Reviews.Author: Normala
Reviews.Content: Rooms are standard and ok overall. The only grouse that we had is the shower is too small. The non commital attitude and non smiling face of the front desk reception is really an issue.. when we checked in he was on the phone for almost 3 or 4 min, ignoring us and only gestured us to sit down after a few minutes and continued with his conversation over the phone. Check in was no hassle since we'd booked the rooms thru booking.com. The hotel keeps our passport as security for payment. We paid for our rooms in full and get to keep our passports. I wonder why they can't keep copies of our passports as most hotel do.. or a copy of our credit card.. they refused these suggestion. The metro station is about 15 to 20 minutes walk from the hotel.. good for walking during winter.. not in summer I think. Shops and restaurants are plenty and within walking distance Taxies are aplenty too... Overall.. it's an ok trip for us; except for the front desk service.

Reviews.Title: “'WORST HOTEL IN THE WORLD = JORMAND HOTEL APARTMENTS BUR DUBAI'!”
Reviews.Author: annie1976_1066
Reviews.Content: Each bed, linen and room smell like an ashtrays and a dirty old mans pub, the beds had hairs in them and the TV was from the 80's. The building is old, smells and looks it, it is the worst place to stay in the world, cheap, dank and it looks it!! The walls have mould and dangerous for children and adults alike! The reception keep your passports!! Unless you pay in full, the kitchen area is dirty with stains from the last occupants on the work tops and two ring hob! The pool and gym are old and dirty not the place you want to get in, looks like you could catch something if you went in, horrid!! Their internet facilites are 20 years out of date, the reception are uneducated morons a monkey could do a better job! Please take my advice and stay somewhere else it is a horrible place in all respects, it turned our mood to sour as we had to go back their in the evenings. The bathrooms oh my go, the shower is not big enough for an adult to shower in, and the bath had a huge crack, health and safety??!! It looks like they haven't changed the white goods since the 70's and they bought them cheap then. So angry that I paid good money to stay there, we stayed out as long as we could just so we didn't spend more time than we needed to there!!

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT advise anyone to stay in this hovel!”
Reviews.Author: hollypohl
Reviews.Content: Without a doubt the worst place ive ever stayed in. Our rooms' walls and ceilings were covered in mould, the room smelt damp and the sheets felt it! the bathroom was a small room again with mould all throughout the grouting. The shower consisted of a tray on the floor with a dirty shower curtain, hense the water leaked everywhere. The carpets were dirty and left us with dirty feet after walking around with no shoes on. The general repair of the rest of hotel was very poor. The staff were ok but again didnt really seem to care! It is not even redemed by good location, the only thing near to it is a bar full of Thai prostitutes. Really would advise anyone not to step foot in this place! No matter how much you pay for a room, at least minimum standards of hygiene should be met and they certainly were not here! We left after 2 nights.

Reviews.Title: “Some rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: lazzarox
Reviews.Content: Nice place. Cheap. There are different kind of rooms. Our first time we spent very good time. Last time: I would not raccomend it. Free parking. Internet too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great cheap hotel for short stay”
Reviews.Author: ExeterHannah
Reviews.Content: The Jormand is a 10 minute taxi ride from the airport. Room was perfectly nice with good mattress, clean, adjustable aircon, iron, hairdryer. The kitchen had 2 hobs, microwave, kettle, toaster and washing machine. Though we didnt cook but could see the cooking utensils and equipment was limited. The neighbourhood was quiet and made up of other large hotels. There is a 24 hour shop behind the hotel, 2 minutes walk. There is a swimming pool and Jacuzzi on the roof, which though we didnt use looked lovely and clean. Reception staff weren’t particularly helpful when asking about tourist attractions or the rules on Ramadan. If you visit in Ramadan it is illegal to eat, drink or smoke in public between 4am and 7pm. However there are tourist restaurants that allow for secret curtained off eating! Overall good hotel for the price (we paid £25)

Reviews.Title: “Very good basic hotel for cheap prize”
Reviews.Author: winker84
Reviews.Content: There were just few things to complain for. The volume chance button didnt work in the control remote so, we had to watch tv only in one very loud volume or without volume at all... In the gym its not very nice that the upkeeperguy come inside and stareing you when u re making athletic practice all the time..customs should leave alone in peace to make their personal atlethicks...

Reviews.Title: “it is not really a 4 star hotel - more suited for backpackers”
Reviews.Author: Dori-DD
Reviews.Content: We had initially booked ourselves at a five star hotel. However, my husband was not able to get his visa on time, and therefore, he had to buy a visa at the emirates counter. As the shopping festival was going on, we were able to only buy a room/studio apartment at a 3 star hotel. We were taken to the hotel together with another couple who were on transit. The hotel entrance is not bad – although pretty basic. The rooms are not at all where I wanted to stay – but we adjusted as it was a place to just come back and sleep. The TV screen is extremely small. The room is quite spacious with attached kitchen. We ordered food on the first day and to our surprise, it was quite good. We were informed that all the rooms were the same size and there was not much any difference. Although the hotel is located a bit inside, we had no problem in getting taxis and their bell boy was extremely friendly and helpful. However, he seemed to be doing all the work 24/7. He was doing room service/bell boy/security/receptionist, but he was good at all his job unlike some of the lazy staff at the reception. The hotel location was cloase to some of the places we wanted to visit. There is also a metro close by – 10 mins walk or you can take a taxi (pay 8 DHS) and then take metro. There are not many restaurants close by and we had to go to an Indian hotel across the street to have our lunch. This Indian hotel seemed quite nice and catering to many people. Overall, this place is quite basic and not worth the money that was paid to emirates. However, if you book online, then this hotel is extremely cheap. However, it is more for backpackers.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive - hence worth it, at least for the location”
Reviews.Author: Sunshinecheer
Reviews.Content: Its a hotel which has seen better days - everything has a dated and tired look, but the beds are firm and comfortable, kitchenette is useable but you will need to cajole every single spoon and plate out of the staff, electric points are old and many are burnt out or not working. Service is reasonable but needs constant prodding. Bathrooms are clean though the towels are threadbare. AC was on full blast and the room felt like the Tundras, controls did not work. A big bath tub on the roof is what is the pool but is clean and useable. Location is fantastic and easily accessible. A small but well stocked supermarket closeby is very handy. Breakfast is fairly good. In conclusion I will say, don't have high hopes and remember that you have not paid much, and you will be happy and satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Psyprass
Reviews.Content: There are a lot of mixed reviews about this place, but I guess it's a luck of the draw. It's not exactly a place of luxury, depite it being advertised as a 4-star hotel, and it is clearly budget, but it was nice and cosy and the staff were very polite and prompt. There are two Jormand complexes so if you venture out, take a hotel business card with you in case you get lost and need a taxi back. We were in the place near Al Karima station and Golden Sands hotel. We had cable TV with a few channels in English, a fridge and a kitchen as well as a safe. The bathrooms weren't so great; there were small patches of mould on the shower walls and hot water ran out by the afternoon, but otherwise it was fine. There was a good buffet breakfast selection, including french toast, fruit salad, pancakes, sausages and croissants, and it was delicious in spite of the hot food being lukewarm. The hotel also has a small gym and swimming pool, as well as two computers and a printer for Internet use (the internet is slow though). The room was decently clean. I don't know about the other rooms but ours was fine. Overall, highly recommended for budget travellers!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed”
Reviews.Author: mighty_zarquan
Reviews.Content: The threadbare red carpet on the entrance steps was the first sign that this hotel is falling apart. We then had to wait over half an hour for our bags to be brought up to our room, which eventually turned up after several requests and a visit back down to the front desk. On closer inspection the room featured a completely broken mattress - one side had totally collapsed and had a sharp metal spike sticking out of it. Again it took several requests and 2 or 3 hours to get this changed - several people came and prodded the mattress, without actually doing anything about it. Other highlights included dangerously exposed wiring, moldy tiles and shower curtain, ineffectual a/c that sounded like there was a truck idling in the room with you, lack of pillows and towels, missing curtains, and windows that didn't shut properly. We were lucky to have only booked a single night! NB - avoid the "chauffeur driven city tour" offered by the hotel, unless you are looking for an overpriced white knuckle ride in a clapped out mini van, driven by a rude, ignorant and down right dangerous driver.

Reviews.Title: “Nice - but far from shops/restaurants”
Reviews.Author: fdeva
Reviews.Content: The majority of hotels in Dubai are fairly nice and accessible so we decided to stay here based on it's price. The hotel was very clean and the beds were comfy. The only down side i'd say is it's location - the hotel is 'not a short stroll away from the shops' as we had seen it being advertised as. Instead it's about a 40 walk away from the main restaurants and Burjuman shopping center - which, in the peak of summer was impossible to do. We'd have to catch a taxi instead which was also abit of a problem in the area as they were hard to find. We discovered if we walked around the corner to the next hotel (about 5 mins away) we'd have better luck at getting one. (Although we did have to wait 20 minutes for a taxi once) Many of the taxi drivers also didn't know where this hotel was located (as apparently it's changed it's name recently) so make sure you take the hotel card with you. In terms of everything else: The service was good, check in/out was fast. The TV had cable and the rooms were cleaned well. It's a good hotel so I'd recommend it based on it's service/rooms but not on it's location. I've given it a 2/5 on the value rating as we had to pay for taxi's to take us to places we thought we could walk to so it went over our budget.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel with 5 star service.”
Reviews.Author: raymal4u
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel, it was like being at home, the staff were caring and brilliant. Located in an ideal place. Rooms were clean and fresh over looking a nice simple veiw.taxis outside whenever the need arrises. Wireless net was a small problem but they have computers which you can use for a small cost. Would definatly come again. I would advise NOT to hire a car at all as there are lots of hidden charges, even if you have a very minor touch they will try and charge you for the full access, which is far too much, (£500) so dont hire a car in Dubai at all... we will be using the taxi service in future....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is ideally located in Burdubai”
Reviews.Author: Ramcksrt
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally located in Burdubai and fairly priced. I was satisfied with the room, however, I was disappointed for Breakfast. There was one person to look after more than 50 guest any any given time. If you go 9.30 am (which a person would prefer on holiday in hotel), my wife and I needed to ask for every item individually. The captain said that his wages are linked to how much left in the Juice fountain or any other item on buffet table. This attitude of the management has put me off to stay at the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible, no respect 4 guests sleep, unprofessional owner & Mgr. Stay away”
Reviews.Author: samsammurai
Reviews.Content: This is our personal experience and what happened to us as we exeprienced it and not hearsay. Advice to anyone who is getting a soecial of any sort. Get everything in writing if they offer you any specials if in the unlikely scenario you happen to stay there. They will blackmail you by holding your passport jacking up the bill, charging you for time you were not there, refusing to email an invoice so you can review it before paying and if you question any descrepancy and refuse to pay the contested amount they threaten to call the police and refuse to give your passport, no matter how urgently you may need it. If you get reservation through internet deals with any legit hotel booking service, they claim they did not advertize with the service and refuse to honor that price or offerring. Their office computor system is archaic, and you cannot correct a document if you get a working document and need to correct it. Their conciere service will insist on helping you with your luggage and not check the cab for all luggage. We lost our bag with our laptop and all components on a business trip and had to extend our visa because we could not wrap what we were there to do, without a laptop, it is not costing us $1540 plus to replace all missing items including eye glasses, because the staff insisted on helping with luggage did not care to look in the back seat, while we were concentrating on being escorted to the front desk, the cab was allowed to leave with one of our bags. We are checking out and renting a car and going to differrent hotels this time to check them ourselves for a long term stay before we move in again. we are on a budget, otherwise ofcourse there are lots of good hotels in Dubai. I love staying at the Marriot, but this time its for a long term stay to get residensy.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice and comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sabee_10
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Jormand for only 1 night. We booked this hotel because it was cheap and we only needed one night before we had reservations at Radisson Blu Media City. The staff at Jormand was not very service minded and came off as "unpolite". Two of the people sitting in the reception were sick, and was not acting very hygienic. Then they went on to touching passports, papers etc. without washing their hands that they had used as tissue. We were glad we had antibac at hand! Furthermore, the hotel had a policy of keeping visitors passports until they checked out. We did not like this and had them take a copy of our passports, and then giving it back to us. This was ok by the staff, though they didn't seem very happy for our request. The room we got was spacious, and ok. I would say maybe this was like a 2-star room. At the roof there was a swimming pool and sunbeds. The roof was very dirty and dusty (keep in mind we're in a deseert:), but they could have done a better job keeping the place clean. Jormand is an ok place to stay, but I think you can do much better for the same price staying in Dubai. I will not go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Jormand Hotel Apartments
HotelInfo.Address: Al Mankhool Rd, near Bur | PO Box 62344, Dubai 7470, United Arab Emirates
